response: "{ \"title\": \"[Hard] Least Common Multiple (LCM) Calculator\", \"description\": \"Write a function `least_common_multiple` that calculates the least common multiple of two integers. The LCM of two numbers is the smallest number that is divisible by both of them.\\n\\n#### Function Signature\\n```python\\ndef least_common_multiple(a: int, b: int) -> int:\\n```\\n\\n#### Input\\n- `a` (int): The first integer.\\n- `b` (int): The second integer.\\n\\n#### Output\\n- Returns the least common multiple of the two input integers.\\n\", \"code\": \"def greatest_common_divisor(a: int, b: int) -> int:\\n    while b != 0:\\n        a, b = b, a % b\\n    return a\\n\\ndef least_common_multiple(a: int, b: int) -> int:\\n    return (a * b) // greatest_common_divisor(a, b)\\n\", \"tests\": [\"assert least_common_multiple(6, 8) == 24\", \"assert least_common_multiple(15, 17) == 255\", \"assert least_common_multiple(9, 3) == 9\"] }"
